verse: David went to a place called Nob, where he visited the priest Ahimelech, who came forward fearfully to meet him.
The priest gave him consecrated bread since the bread of the Presence was replaced when other fresh, hot bread was brought before the Eternal One and no other bread was available.
Now one of Saul’s servants, Doeg the Edomite, the chief of Saul’s shepherds, was waiting before the Eternal that day.
So David left and fled that same day from Saul and went to Saul’s enemy, King Achish of Gath.
The king’s servants reminded the king,
When David heard that these were the kinds of things people were saying about him, he was afraid of what Achish, the king of Gath, might do,
so he acted differently when they were around and even pretended to be insane. He scarred the doors at the city’s gates with his fingernails and drooled into his beard.
